profile.ja: 1943年12月20日、新潟市南区（旧西蒲原郡味方村大字吉江）で生まれた。その後、5歳から18歳まで、長岡市で育つ。研究分野は、複素代数幾何学、複素解析幾何学、特異点論であり、研究テーマは、「射影的方法による複素代数多様体の位相的、解析的研究」である。代数曲線、代数曲面の研究に用いられた古典的方法を高次元化するとともに、代数多様体の外在的（extrinsic）性質を研究する古典的代数幾何学と、より内在的（intrinsic）性質を研究する現代代数幾何学の間に、”橋”を渡すことを目指している。近年は、計算代数、記号力学系にも関心を持っている。
profile.en:
Birthday: 1943.12.20 (Mon)
Research Theme: Topological and Analytical Study on Complex Projective Varieties by Projection Method
Career:
1968-1973 Research Institute for Mathematical Sciences, Kyoto University, Research Assistant
1973-1974 College of Liberal Arts, Kagoshima University, Lecturer
1974-1986 College of Liberal Arts, Kagoshima University, Associate Professor
1986-1997 College of Liberal Arts, Kagoshima University, Professor
1997-2009 Faculty of Science, Kagoshima University, Professor
2009- Professor Emeritus at Kagoshima University, Part-time Lecturer at Education Center of Kagoshima University (Mathematics)
2011- Part-time Lecturer at Faculty of Science of Kagoshima University (Department of Mathematics and Computer Science)
2012- Part-time Lecturer at Faculty of Education of Kagoshima Univesity (Department of Mathematics)
1994-1995 Center for Advanced Study at the Norwegian Academy, Visiting Researcher

paper_title.ja: Infinitesimal mixed Torelli problem for algebraic surfaces with ordinary singularities, II
paper_title.en: INFINITESIMAL MIXED TORELLI PROBLEM FOR ALGEBRAIC SURFACES WITH ORDINARY SINGULARITIES, II

description.ja: "In Part I of this paper ([14]), we have formulated the infinitesimal mixed Torelli problem for an algebraic surface with ordinary singularities S. In this Part II, we formulate the cohomological infinitesimal mixed Torelli problem for such S, which enable us to deal with the problem more easily. We give some cohomological sufficient conditions under which the infinitesimal mixed Torelli problem is affirmatively solved. We also give some examples."
description.en: In Part I of this paper ([14]), we have formulated the infinitesimal mixed Torelli problem for an algebraic surface with ordinary singularities S. In this Part II, we formulate the cohomological infinitesimal mixed Torelli problem for such S, which enable us to deal with the problem more easily. We give some cohomological sufficient conditions under which the infinitesimal mixed Torelli problem is affirmatively solved. We also give some examples.

paper_title.ja: Infinitesimal mixed Torelli problem for algebraic surfaces with ordinary singularities, I
paper_title.en: INFINITESIMAL MIXED TORELLI PROBLEM FOR ALGEBRAIC SURFACES WITH ORDINARY SINGULARITIES, I

description.ja: In this paper, we formulate the infinitesimal mixed Torelli problem for an algebraic surface S with ordinary singularities. We use 2-cubic hyperresolution a_●: X_● →S (● ∈ □_2) of S in the sense of F. Guillen, V. Navarro Aznar et al. not only to describe the mixed Hodge structure on the cohomology of S, but also to describe the infinitesimal locally trivial deformation space H^1 (S, Θ_S) of S, where Θ_S: =Homo_S(Ω^1_S, O_S). For an analytic family π: G→ (M, o) of locally trivial deformations of S, parametrized by a pointed complex space (M, o), we define the Kodaira-Spencer map σ_o: T_oM →H^1 (S, Θ_S). We show that if each fiber of the family π: G→ (M, o) is projective, then the variation of mixed Hodge structures, arising from this family, can be described by taking 2-cubic hyper-resolution of its each fiber simultaneously. We give a formula which describes the relation between the Kodaira-Spencer map (σ_o: T_oM → H^1 (S, Θ_S) and the Jacobian map dφ_o of the so-called period map φ: M → M_<mix> (H^1(S)z))×M_<mix> (H^2(S)z)) at o ∈ M, where M_<mix> (H^e(S)z)), l=1, 2, denotes the modular variety of mixed Hodge structures on H^l (S) z: = H^l (S, Z) modulo torsion (Theorem 3.17).
description.en: In this paper, we formulate the infinitesimal mixed Torelli problem for an algebraic surface S with ordinary singularities. We use 2-cubic hyperresolution a_●: X_● →S (● ∈ □_2) of S in the sense of F. Guillen, V. Navarro Aznar et al. not only to describe the mixed Hodge structure on the cohomology of S, but also to describe the infinitesimal locally trivial deformation space H^1 (S, Θ_S) of S, where Θ_S: =Homo_S(Ω^1_S, O_S). For an analytic family π: G→ (M, o) of locally trivial deformations of S, parametrized by a pointed complex space (M, o), we define the Kodaira-Spencer map σ_o: T_oM →H^1 (S, Θ_S). We show that if each fiber of the family π: G→ (M, o) is projective, then the variation of mixed Hodge structures, arising from this family, can be described by taking 2-cubic hyper-resolution of its each fiber simultaneously. We give a formula which describes the relation between the Kodaira-Spencer map (σ_o: T_oM → H^1 (S, Θ_S) and the Jacobian map dφ_o of the so-called period map φ: M → M_<mix> (H^1(S)z))×M_<mix> (H^2(S)z)) at o ∈ M, where M_<mix> (H^e(S)z)), l=1, 2, denotes the modular variety of mixed Hodge structures on H^l (S) z: = H^l (S, Z) modulo torsion (Theorem 3.17).

paper_title.en: On certain hypersurfaces with non-isolated singularities in P-4(C)

description.en: We give an example of hypersurfaces with non-isolated singularities in P-4(C), whose normalizations have isolated rational quadruple points only as singularities. From Schlessinger's criterion, it follows that these isolated rational singular points are rigid under small deformations.
